Programmatic exploration of HCA data

C_HCAMatrixBrowser.Rmd

Objectives:

  • Explore HCA matrix data programmatically
  • Use the HCAMatrixBrowser ‘high level’ interface to filter, create, and retrieve a LoomExperiment with a custom count matrix.
  • Introduce HCAMatrixBrowser ‘low level’ operations for matrix retrieval.

The HCAMatrixBrowser package

library(HCAMatrixBrowser)
print(citation("HCAMatrixBrowser"), style = "text")
## Ramos M, Morgan M (2020). _HCAMatrixBrowser: Extract and manage matrix
## data from the Human Cell Atlas project_. R package version 1.0.1.

Built on the HCA Matrix Service RESTful API.

hca <- HCAMatrix()
  • Create an object that references the service.

‘High-level’ use

Discover available filters.

filters <- available_filters(hca)
length(filters)
## [1] 43
grep("project", filters, value = TRUE)
## [1] "project.provenance.document_id"         
## [2] "project.project_core.project_short_name"
## [3] "project.project_core.project_title"
  • Filters available on 43 different facets
  • The project.project_core.project_title filter corresponds to titles on the matrix browser web page.

Select a particular experiment

title <- "Assessing the relevance of organoids to model inter-individual variation"
hca1 <- filter(
    hca,
    project.project_core.project_title == title
)
filters(hca1) %>%
    str()
## List of 3
##  $ op   : 'scalar' chr "="
##  $ field: chr "project.project_core.project_title"
##  $ value: chr "Assessing the relevance of organoids to model inter-individual variation"

Combine filters

grep("detected", filters, value = TRUE)
## [1] "genes_detected"
filter_detail(hca, "genes_detected") %>%
    str()
## List of 5
##  $ field_description: chr "Count of genes with a non-zero count."
##  $ field_name       : chr "genes_detected"
##  $ field_type       : chr "numeric"
##  $ maximum          : int 13108
##  $ minimum          : int 2
  • genes_detected can be used to filter only cells with more than 500 genes observed.
  • Combine with project selection.
hca1 <- filter(
    hca,
    project.project_core.project_title == title &
    genes_detected >= 500
)
filters(hca1)

Retrieve the custom selection of cells

> loom <- loadHCAMatrix(hca1, format = "loom")
HCAMatrixBrowser cache directory set to:
    /Users/ma38727/Library/Caches/org.R-project.R/R/HCAMatrixBrowser
  (\) waiting for query completion.......... 00:00:02
  (-) waiting for query completion.......... 00:00:06
...
  (/) waiting for query completion.......... 00:08:13
  |======================================================================| 100%
  • Matrix assembled by the service (remotely) ‘on the fly’
> loom
class: LoomExperiment 
dim: 58347 43861 
metadata(0):
assays(1): matrix
rownames: NULL
rowData names(9): Accession Gene ... genus_species isgene
colnames(43861): 0006d1a2669431b298d08f010da6480b
  000f429f8f0c461ce9fe5a82b0375994 ... ffeb17d412dc2de0ac6e421f85eb15db
  ffef9246733b290086fd66e084905567
colData names(44): CellID analysis_protocol.protocol_core.protocol_id
  ... specimen_from_organism.provenance.document_id total_umis
rowGraphs(0): NULL
colGraphs(0): NULL
> range(colSums(assay(loom)[, 1:1000] > 0))
[1] 502 4660
  • The size of the experiment, compared to full version retrieved earlier, and the range of genes per cell give us confidence that the filters have been applied correctly.

‘Low-level’ operations

hca %>%
    tags() %>%
    dplyr::filter(tag == "v1") %>%
    dplyr::select(operation)
## # A tibble: 10 x 1
##    operation                                    
##    <chr>                                        
##  1 matrix.lambdas.api.v1.core.get_feature_detail
##  2 matrix.lambdas.api.v1.core.get_features      
##  3 matrix.lambdas.api.v1.core.get_field_detail  
##  4 matrix.lambdas.api.v1.core.get_fields        
##  5 matrix.lambdas.api.v1.core.get_filter_detail 
##  6 matrix.lambdas.api.v1.core.get_filters       
##  7 matrix.lambdas.api.v1.core.get_format_detail 
##  8 matrix.lambdas.api.v1.core.get_formats       
##  9 matrix.lambdas.api.v1.core.get_matrix        
## 10 matrix.lambdas.api.v1.core.post_matrix

hca$matrix.lambdas.api.v1.core.post_matrix
## matrix.lambdas.api.v1.core.post_matrix 
## matrix.lambdas.api.v1.core.post_matrix 
## Description:
##   Request an expression matrix using a set of filters to be ANDed and
##   applied to the HCA expression data.
## 
## Parameters:
##   filter (object)
##     Filter to apply in a matrix request.
##   fields (array[string])
##     Metadata fields to include in output matrix.
##   format (string)
##     Format for the output matrix.
##   feature (string)
##     Feature type to include in the output matrix. For example, genes
##     vs. transcripts.
  • End-points exposed to the R user.
  • matrix.lambdas.api.v1.core.post_matrix() requests construction of a customized count matrix, based on a series of filters, metadata fields, etc.

Summary

  • HCAMatrixBrowser allows programmatic access to the HCA Matrix Service.
  • Both complete and data filtered to precise criteria can be retrieved.
  • The full RESTful HCA Matrix Service API is available for further customization.
